intro: Hedyotis purpurea var. setiscaphia, commonly known as purple mosquito plant, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking a compact, shade-tolerant plant.
